parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the brake master cylinder can cause the brake pedal to sink to the floor, leading to extended stopping distances, which can increase the risk of accidents and collisions.
symptoms: The brake pedal feels soft or spongy
the brake pedal sinks to the floor
the vehicle takes longer than usual to stop
the brake pedal has a delayed response to braking.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the brake rotors can cause the vehicle to vibrate or pulsate when the brakes are applied, leading to reduced braking performance and increased stopping distances, which can increase the risk of accidents and collisions.
symptoms: The vehicle vibrates or pulsates when the brakes are applied
the brakes make a grinding or screeching noise
the brake pedal feels uneven or wobbly.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the engine head gaskets can cause the vehicle to overheat, leading to engine damage, loss of power, and potentially resulting in a breakdown or accident.
symptoms: Smoke coming out of the engine
engine overheating
warped or split head gaskets
loss of engine power
coolant leakage.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the fan belt can cause the engine to overheat, leading to engine damage, loss of power, and potentially resulting in a breakdown or accident.
symptoms: Engine overheating
fan belt failure
engine noise
coolant leakage.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the seat belt to properly restrain the driver or passenger can lead to increased risk of injury or fatality in the event of a collision.
symptoms: The seat belt does not retract or tighten properly
the seat belt allows excessive movement or slack
the seat belt fails to hold the driver or passenger in place during a collision.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The design and functionality of door-mounted seat belts may be perceived as unsafe, potentially leading to a lack of trust in the vehicle's safety features.
symptoms: None reported
as this complaint is based on the driver's perception of the safety belt design.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the alternator can cause the vehicle's electrical system to malfunction, leading to a loss of power, dim or flickering headlights, and potentially even an under-hood fire, which can result in damage to the vehicle and pose a risk to the driver and passengers.
symptoms: The alternator belt squeals or makes a loud noise
the battery warning light is illuminated
the vehicle's electrical accessories (such as the radio or wipers) malfunction
the headlights are dim or flickering
smoke or flames are visible under the hood.
